entries.title: Watch: Late-Night hosts attempt to joke about Biden's secret documents scandal. Fail.
entries.description:
This week, late-night hosts Jimmy Fallon, Jimmy Kimmel, and Stephen Colbert attempted to mock Biden for having secret documents in his home and garage. But even with such great material, their "jokes" still fell flat.

Jimmy Fallon quickly deflected to also mocking Donald Trump: "I’m not saying Biden’s getting worried, but he just texted Rudy Giuliani." Earlier in the week, he also insinuated Biden is a dumb-dumb, saying, "Today Obama was like ‘Nothing to worry about. If Joe had access, it wasn’t important. Don’t worry about it.'”

\u201c"I'm not saying Biden's getting worried, but he just texted Rudy Giuliani," Jimmy Fallon" joked of Biden's classified documents scandal. https://t.co/WQKLCAGTTM\u201d
— TheWrap (@TheWrap) 1673624903

Jimmy Kimmel also tried to deflect by claiming "Any time documents are mishandled, top-secret documents, it needs to be taken seriously. That’s something Republicans and Democrats believe. Although Republicans have only believed it since Monday.”

\u201c\u201cAnd, of course, anytime documents are mishandled, top-secret documents, it needs to be taken seriously. That is something Republicans and Democrats believe, although Republicans have only believed it since Monday.\u201d \u2014 Jimmy Kimmel https://t.co/B9Ew4epOe6\u201d
— New York Times Arts (@New York Times Arts) 1673528365

Stephen Colbert imitated Biden's defense over the documents found in his garage, which was basically, "I have a Corvette!" Colbert donned aviators and said, “Come on, it’s in a locked garage. You’d think I’d leave my sweet cherry Vette out on the main drag where some street thugs could scuff it with their switchblades? No sirree. I keep that baby locked up tight in my garage. Sunday afternoons, I go in there and buff it with a handful of missile maps.”

Colbert also attempted to explain why this is totally, completely, 100% different from Donald Trump having secret documents, even though Biden likely did not have the authority to declassify intelligence memos as Vice President. Colbert cited Trump's noncompliance and "nefarious" behavior, and concluded with: "The FBI raids Mar-a-Lago and finds hundreds of documents and he [Trump] goes, ‘Oh I knew I had those, I packed them myself, but don’t worry, I declassified them with my mind.’”

Biden Returns Classified Docs | Dr. Dre vs. Marjorie Taylor Greene www.youtube.com

Yesterday, the White House announced five additional pages of classified material had been discovered at Biden's Delaware home. The first round of documents, discovered in Biden's old office at the Penn Biden Center, were dated between 2013 and 2016 and consisted of intelligence briefings and memos on Ukraine, Iran, and the United Kingdom.

Attorney General Merrick Garland has since appointed Special Counsel Robert Hur to investigate “the possible unauthorized removal and retention of classified documents or other records discovered.”

entries.title: WATCH: Boston 'erects' statue to honor Martin Luther King and it looks like a giant...
entries.description:
Tomorrow is Martin Luther King Jr. Day, and in honor of Dr. King, Boston erected a $10M bronze statue in the Boston common. The piece is called "Embrace" and is modeled after a photo of Martin Luther King and his wife. But for some odd reason, the artist decided to only include their arms and not their heads or other discerning features.

\u201cThere is a social media controversy about the new bronze sculpture in the #Boston Common honoring Martin Luther King Jr. and Coretta Scott King. Called Boston\u2019s \u201cstatue of liberty,\u201d many are saying it resembles something else.\u201d
— Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08 (@Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08) 1673702087

This statue is pretty special as it seems to have shapeshifting abilities. Many say it represents a large penis. Others, a butt. And still, some say it represents a giant turd. What no one is saying, however, is that it looks anything like Martin Luther King and his wife.

The artist said of the statue, "not everyone has arms and hands, but all of us have been embraced." Okay...sure. But why does it look like a giant phallus? The design miraculously beat out 125 other design proposals, which I would be very curious to see.

\u201cA new tribute for civil rights icon Martin Luther King Jr. and his wife, Coretta Scott King, is being unveiled in Boston. \n\n@CraigMelvin speaks with the artist and @OfficialMLK3 @ArndreaKing about the new memorial that highlights their love.\u201d
— TODAY (@TODAY) 1673618931

Perhaps we're all just too dim-witted to understand the complexities and interpretations of modern art. Surely, this is better than the cathedrals and paintings of the Middle Ages. It's reinventing the wheel!

On the bright side, in terms of modern art, it could be much, much worse. Remember when Catholic University of America displayed a painting of George Floyd as Jesus?

\u201cNEW: Paintings depicting George Floyd as Jesus Christ hang in both The Catholic University of America\u2019s campus ministry office and its law school, students say.\n\n\u201cIt is just another symptom of the liberalization and secularization of our campus." \n\nhttps://t.co/EkJtP229tw\u201d
— Mary Margaret Olohan (@Mary Margaret Olohan) 1637621095

The painting, called "Mama," was protested by students and stolen twice. After facing nationwide backlash, the University claimed the painting depicted Jesus and not George Floyd, citing the Greek letters in the halo that signify Jesus's divinity. But the artist previously said it was created to mourn the death of George Floyd.

So, while the statue of Martin Luther King is bad, at least it isn't blasphemous! Which I guess is the bar for modern art now.

But it still looks like a penis.

entries.title: Maren Morris sobs to Ru Paul and apologizes for how not woke the country music industry is
entries.description:
Maren Morris is a woke hardo. Every time she speaks, she wants everyone to know she "thinks" all the right things and isn't like those other backward rubes who listen to or work in country music. The latest example is the pop star getting emotional on RuPaul's Drag Race. It's the Grand Ol' Opry for virtue signaling.

Morris was a guest and sobbed while telling Ru it was her "decade-long DREAM" to be a judge on the game show.

Then came this:

Coming from country music and its relationship with LGBTQ+ members, I just want to say I’m sorry. And I love you guys for making me feel like a brave voice in country music. So I just thank you guys so much for inspiring me.

Unclear is if she had something specific in mind, or if Morris still can't calm down about the Brittany Aldean controversy from last year. To recap, Aldean posted the following video to her Instagram page. It was a humorous commentary on the parents who express their political beliefs by pushing their own gender-based ideology on their children.

View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Brittany Aldean (@brittanyaldean)

Morris attacked her for it, claiming "It’s so easy to, like, not be a scumbag human? Sell your clip-ins and zip it, Insurrection Barbie."

Country star Jason Aldean, Brittany's husband, snarked about it as he came to her defense. He was dropped by his long-time PR firm as a result. Though the Aldeans got the last laugh on Halloween with a parody of Anchorman.

Last we heard, Morris was "uncomfortable" being around her peers and boycotted the CMA awards.

Besides being a country fan, I'm also a conservative punk rock fan. A lot of the artists I listen to there have a way different political opinion than me. It is what it is. Separate the art from the artist and all that. My only issues are when a) the artist is an insufferable douche about it, and b) the artist sounds like they hate the half the country that disagrees with them just to score woke points.

Morris is on the wrong side of history in both those cases. And while I like the cut Maren did with Thomas Rhett and thought Girl was a good album, it wasn't that good.

Plus, I seemed to recall her being attacked as an alleged "culture vulture" by the same people whose approval she is desperate for now.

entries.title: Watch: Mel Brooks releases trailer for 'History of the World Part 2' and I want to believe it won't stink on ice
entries.description:
Mel Brooks has released the trailer for History of the World Part 2, the long-awaited sequel to 1981's History of the World Part 1. Though thanks to Ye, I don't think we're getting "Jews in Space." I see a few of my colleagues who are all like "ZOMG, this means you can still make comedy in America." I have my doubts about this.

First, let's hear from Uncle Mel.

The names you know. The history you don’t. History of the World Part II, a four night event, streaming March 6 on @hulu! #HistoryOfTheWorldPart2 pic.twitter.com/bMFHuc1WN3
— Mel Brooks (@MelBrooks) January 13, 2023

Mel Brooks is the man responsible for 50% of everything I know to be funny. The other 50% encompasses everything from Groucho Marx to that viral video of the failed guitar thief.

Uncle Mel is literally looking over me as I write this.

I have two big concerns. The first is, when was the last time you remember a laugh-out-loud comedy? Studios are more concerned with what bloggers or random idiots on Twitter a joke may offend than to allow a movie to be funny.

The only exception is if you are offending people for the "right" political reasons.

There are a number of names attacked to this project that are red flags: Josh Gad, Wanda Sykes, Seth Rogen, etc.

My other concern is 99.86% of all reboots SUCK. There are exceptions. Cobra Kai gets it right, and I loved the new Kids in the Hall series. The rest are horrible. They come across as a parody of the source material people loved. Which in this case would be a parody of a parody.

Will History of the World Part 2 be a Mel Brooks project? Or will it be something that is trying too hard to be a Mel Brooks project?

Uncle Mel is listed as one of the two writers on IMDB. That's a good sign. And he has yet to let me down. Remember, we all agreed never to speak of Dracula Dead and Loving It.

History of the World Part 2 drops on Hulu on March 6th. I'm hoping for the best.

entries.title: Buffalo Bills QB testifies to awakening after Damar Hamlin recovery: 'God is real'
entries.description:
Two weeks ago when Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin went into cardiac arrest after a collision, Americans came together in prayer. Sure, there were haters on Twitter who were all like "derpity derp, pray to science." But normal people were openly praying and talking about God in a way I don't quite remember happening in America. There was even an actual prayer -- an actual Christian prayer -- said on ESPN. Yes, that ESPN.

Bills QB Josh Allen felt it. And after saying "God is real" after last Sunday's game, attempting to explain what he felt on the Kyle Brandt's Basement Podcast.

Josh Allen talks emotional week, Damar Hamlin & Wild Card matchup | Kyle Brandt’s Basement youtu.be

I haven’t been the most devoted Christ-follower in my life, and I’ve had my different beliefs and thoughts and ideas and stuff like that, but something got hold of me there, and it was extremely powerful, that I couldn’t deny. ... I’m extremely moved. I don’t really have the words to explain it.

Nothing but respect for MY quarterback.

Allen is almost there, but not quite: "spirituality," "higher power," "not going to judge." He sounds like he is trying to express what he believes while still wanting not to "offend" people who feel different. But he's trying. And when our culture is so afraid to admit to God's existence out loud, trying counts.

While Allen may not have the words to explain it, Coach Tony Dungy does:

These comments by Josh Allen prove to me that Romans 8:28 is true-God can use all things—even devastating things—for good. I think Damar Hamlin’s injury got a lot of people’s attention. I’m praying for Damar’s full recovery & that more people see what Josh saw—That God is real! https://t.co/kQblVRrxHS
— Tony Dungy (@TonyDungy) January 14, 2023

Damar Hamlin is out of the hospital and will no doubt be there as the Bills utterly disembowel the Dolphins on Sunday. God is real. But Miami beating the Bills at home would be the work of someone else.
